;;尼克·伊格纳西奥 (Nick Ignacio)，Spotsylvania 县法院书记员的独立候选人，站在弗雷德里克斯堡提前投票地点的竞选标志旁，弗吉尼亚州，上个月。
;

;周二，数以百万计的美国人前往投票站投票，并投票表决措施，这些措施可能会对乔·拜登保住白宫一年后的总统任期做出临时裁决。

;

;选民将选出肯塔基州和密西西比州的州长，决定新泽西州和弗吉尼亚州的立法控制权，并决定俄亥俄州宪法是否应保护堕胎权。

;
;

;;相关：;;弗吉尼亚州白人选民的邮寄民主党称选票面临的挑战较少;

;
;

;弗吉尼亚州参议院全部 40 个席位和该州众议院全部 100 个席位 ;正在进行中;。民主党的目标是保持或扩大在参议院的 22-18 优势，并在众议院赢得多数席位，共和党目前在众议院以 52-48 领先。

;

;选民的决定可能会受到众议院事件的影响。国家政治舞台，从拜登的低支持率到最近众议院的混乱，共和党人为选举议长而苦苦挣扎三周。

;

;“人们说，哦，这没关系，因为这就是政治中心主任拉里·萨巴托 (Larry Sabato) 表示：“国家是国家的，但人们不会做出这些区分。”弗吉尼亚大学夏洛茨维尔分校。 “国家是州，州是地方。他们正在衡量各方的价值，一一比较。我不知道我们是否有任何方法可以衡量它，但美国众议院共和党的失灵确实产生了一些影响。”

;

;弗吉尼亚州是南方唯一没有对特朗普施加进一步限制的州。 ;最高法院以来的堕胎法院推翻了去年具有里程碑意义的罗伊诉韦德案裁决。但共和党人承诺，如果他们获得立法机构的控制权，他们将在共和党州长格伦·杨金 (Glenn Youngkin) 的支持下通过一项为期 15 周的堕胎禁令。

;

;杨金 (Youngkin) 在 2021 年通过制定“父母权利”而激怒了民主党人” 他的签名问题这次没有出现在选票上，但选举将受到密切关注;他未来政治前景的线索;。反对唐纳德·特朗普的共和党捐助者可能会试图说服扬金在最后一刻参加 2024 年总统初选。

;

;共和党人还在民主党坚定的新泽西州寻求对任一立法会的控制权，该州的所有席位大会和参议院的席位都是争夺的。自 2021 年以来，共和党已经取得了进展，当时他们翻转了七个席位，并正在推动从经济到 K-12 教育中的家长权利等一系列问题。

;

;与此同时，在保守的肯塔基州，民主党州长;安迪·贝希尔;，正在竞选重新- 竞选对手是共和党州检察长丹尼尔·卡梅伦。贝希尔的竞选活动正在宣传他为肯塔基州带来就业机会、支持公立学校、扩大医疗服务范围以及制定严格政策来遏制冠状病毒传播的记录。

; ;

;卡梅伦是非裔美国人，;宣扬特朗普的支持;。他关注公共安全、大流行期间学校停课造成的学习损失，以及全国范围内共和党人倡导的文化战争问题，例如反对对变性儿童进行性别肯定的照顾。

;

;在密西西比州，共和党州长泰特里夫斯正在竞选连任，反对民主党;布兰登·普雷斯利;，前小镇市长，歌手埃尔维斯·普雷斯利的远房表弟。虽然里夫斯在极其保守的南部州的民调中领先，但普雷斯利在竞选过程中筹集了更多资金。

;

;在政治广告中，里夫斯指责普雷斯利得到了州外的支持。自由派人士反对对跨性别青年进行性别肯定护理的禁令，比如里夫斯二月份签署的法律。普雷斯利表示，他不支持对未成年人进行性别确认的照顾，也不支持跨性别女孩参加女子运动，并且正在竞选减税和扩大医疗补助的承诺。

;

;上周候选人之间的辩论证明;一场脾气暴躁的事件;，里维斯和普雷斯利互相辱骂、互相议论.
;
; 俄亥俄州的一项投票问题询问选民是否将堕胎权写入州宪法，此举将使共和党州长迈克·德温签署的六周限制成为法律变得毫无意义。该法律目前处于搁置状态，等待州最高法院的诉讼。这次投票受到密切关注，因为全国各地的民主党人希望增加一系列与堕胎相关的投票措施;赢得 2022 年;。
;
; 俄亥俄州选民还将回答有关该州是否应将娱乐用大麻合法化的投票问题。如果获得批准，该法规将使 21 岁以上成年人的大麻合法化，并对其进行监管和征税，从而扩大目前大麻的合法药用用途。
;
; 全国各地的城市将于周二选举市长。在费城，民主党;Cherelle Parker和共和党David Oh;随着民主党人吉姆·肯尼的市长任期届满，两位前市议会成员正在争夺一个空缺席位。在休斯顿，以美国国会女议员希拉·杰克逊·李 (Sheila Jackson Lee) 和州参议员约翰·惠特迈尔 (John Whitmire) 为首的众多候选人正在竞争接替限期市长西尔维斯特·特纳 (Sylvester Turner)（同为民主党人）。

;

;A民主党人的糟糕夜晚可能被视为对拜登的严峻反思，拜登的支持率;只有 37%;。调查显示，在假设的复赛中，他与特朗普并驾齐驱。

;;阿富汗队的 Farshad Noor（左）和卡塔尔队的 Ahmed Alaaeldin 争夺球
;

;大部分时间阿富汗男足将抵制下周对阵卡塔尔的世界杯预选赛，以抗议他们所说的该国足协不合格的待遇。

;

;《卫报》看到了一封由三名海外人士签署的信件上个月在预选赛第一轮击败蒙古队的队长球员本周被送往国际足联和亚洲足球联合会（AFC），概述了他们的投诉。其中包括对阿富汗足协 (AFF) 严重腐败的指控。

;

;“最后一根稻草出现在最后一个营地，当时我们一大群人认为我们已经受够了 – 18 名球员聚集在一起，国家联盟球队绍森德联队球员努尔·胡辛 (Noor Husin) 表示：“如果我们要继续前进，我们就必须阻止这一切。”

;
;

;;相关： ;;英国议会呼吁国际足联支持流亡的阿富汗女队;

;
;

;“我们真的想要改变。我们想帮助国内球员，因为他们从国际足联得到的钱没有得到正确的使用。我们的航班可能最差，而且我们不得不住在不合格的酒店。我们作为一个团队走到一起，因为我们希望阿富汗足球向前发展，但我们相信，目前的负责人不会让足球向前发展。”

;

;队长 Farshad努尔和他的前任 Faysal Shayesteh 是签署这封信的其他球员，这封信要求国际足联调查有关 AFF 高级官员挪用本应投资于该国足球发展的资金的指控。

;

;“每年我们的联合会都会得到国际足联和亚足联的财政支持，”效力于印度球队斯雷尼迪·德干队的沙耶斯特说道。 “我们希望向世界展示一个积极的阿富汗，因此我们要求国际足联停止在经济上支持我们的足协，因为这些钱进入了一个统治该国足球的团伙的口袋。”

;

; AFF秘书长贝拉姆·西迪基否认了这些指控，并表示“此类行为属于国际足联合规团队的管辖范围。”如果这些资金来自赞助，则联合会的审计必须披露此信息。前任秘书长（法齐尔·穆罕默德·沙哈卜）完成了 2021 年审计报告，并将其提交给国际足联。

;

;“自 2021 年 8 月政权过渡以来，国际足联或任何外部来源均未有资金转移至国际足联。”足球联合会的银行账户。因此，之前有关此问题的任何操作都不在我的知识范围内。”

; ;

;球员们还声称，AFF 执行委员会的成员在进入下一轮比赛后，分发了为球队提供的 30,000 美元奖金的一半。世界杯彼此之间。西迪基对此提出异议，并表示球员们已经获得了 20,000 美元，剩下的 10,000 美元用于“支付我们国家队在训练营期间的费用，因为过去 10 个月我们的银行账户里没有任何钱”。

;

;他补充说，这笔钱“用于支付来自各省的国家队球员的国内航班费用，因为国际足联并不为所有必须加入国家队的球员提供国内航班费用”。

; < Shayesteh 和他的队友还声称，AFF 领导层成员挪用了球员参加比赛的机票钱。在《卫报》看到的文件中，AFF 向国际足联索回了近 65,000 美元，用于 6 月份在吉尔吉斯斯坦参加中亚足协国家杯的费用，最初预计费用约为 45,000 美元。

; ;

;西迪基否认了这些指控，并表示费用增加是由于旅行社的原始报价已过期，这意味着他们被迫在出发前几个小时购买航班。 “一些球员抱怨没有提供商务舱航班，而商务舱航班通常由职业球队使用，”他说。 “然而，足协无法从其资金中包租或支付商务舱航班费用。”

;

;球员们的信中还指责 AFF 主席夸大了国际足联支付的酒店客房费用——这一指控也被被西迪基否认。 “事实是，所有酒店都会将发票连同银行账户详细信息一起发送给国际足联。一旦获得国际足联合规团队的批准，这笔钱就会直接转入酒店的账户，这可能需要相当长的时间。”

;

;据了解，前布拉德福德和雷克瑟姆后卫阿什利·韦斯特伍德已被接洽，希望能够接受此事。阿卜杜拉·阿尔·穆泰里 (Abdullah Al Mutairi) 因在对阵蒙古的预选赛前拒绝在比赛单上签字而被解雇。由于对争议的明显担忧，韦斯特伍德尚未签署合同。

;

;一支主要由本地球员组成的阵容已被选中参加对阵卡塔尔的预选赛，比赛将于沙特阿拉伯举行。 AFF 签署了一项协议，让该国主办所有主场比赛。

;

;“我们一直在塔吉克斯坦进行主场比赛，如果你看看我们的结果，那是我们有优势的国家 – 即使对阵卡塔尔时，我们只以 1-0 落败，并且错过了一个点球——因为天气是一个很大的优势，”Shayesteh 说道。 “但现在他们把我们的主场比赛卖给了沙特阿拉伯，那里天气很热，所以这对我们不利。”

;

;国际足联发言人表示：“国际足联最近获悉这些指控，目前正在调查此事。”

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 18:22:01 +0800 Man arrested over 2013 killing of Russian art dealer in Amsterdamhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/07/man-arrested-2013-killing-russian-art-dealer-amsterdam
;;2023-11-07T09:00:03Z;
;
;;IJ 河
;

;荷兰警方逮捕了一名与可怕的悬案谋杀案有关的嫌疑人2013 年，在阿姆斯特丹 IJ 河的一个蓝色塑料袋中发现了一名富有的俄罗斯艺术品经销商的躯干。

;

;在与《卫报》分享的一份声明中，警方表示，他们已从该公司逮捕了一名 62 岁的男子。周二，阿姆斯特丹，嫌疑人的 DNA 据称与圣彼得堡艺术品经销商亚历山大·莱文 (Aleksandr Levin) 遗体上发现的痕迹相符，亚历山大·莱文被杀时已 65 岁。

;

;莱文的尸体上有头部2013 年 1 月底，一名路人在中央火车站对面的阿姆斯特丹港区附近的水中发现了受害者的四肢。

;

;但由于无法获取受害者的指纹或牙科记录，荷兰人不得不采取行动。警方花了近十年的时间才确认遗骸属于莱文，这是在通过国际刑警组织失踪人员数据库将受害者的 DNA 与俄罗斯亲属进行匹配后取得的突破。

;

;荷兰警方周二没有透露嫌疑人的身份或可能的谋杀动机，但表示处理莱文尸体的方法表明这是一起有预谋的谋杀。
;
; 警方称，在莱文的躯干和用于掩盖其的“包装材料”上发现了嫌疑人的 DNA。他们补充说，嫌疑人住在发现尸体的地点附近。

;

;虽然此前曾与俄罗斯警方就调查进行过合作，但荷兰当局表示，自战争以来，与莫斯科的所有联系已被切断在乌克兰。

;

;莱文的儿子说，他“感谢荷兰警方和所有促成这次逮捕的人所做的工作”。

;

;“我想知道是谁杀了我的孩子”父亲又是为了什么。有太多问题没有得到解答，”这位儿子在与俄罗斯《卫报》的电话中补充道，出于对自身安全的担忧，他要求隐去自己的姓氏。

;

;根据一名失踪者的说法根据俄罗斯调查委员会发布的个人报告，莱文于2013年1月17日登上了从圣彼得堡飞往阿姆斯特丹的飞机。他本应于第二天乘飞机前往西班牙大加那利岛，但未能登机。;

;莱文在圣彼得堡作为东正教圣像的著名经销商而享有盛誉，他有着一段涉及非法拥有和贩运艺术品的不为人知的过去。

;

;他于 2017 年首次被判处 10 个月监禁。 1998 年，警方在史基浦机场发现他拥有一本罕见的 18 世纪地图集，由著名制图师约翰内斯·范科伊伦 (Johannes van Keulen) 绘制，据报道该地图集属于莫斯科的俄罗斯国家图书馆。俄罗斯警方搜查了莱文在圣彼得堡的公寓，据报道他们在那里发现了数百件被盗的圣像。

;

;据圣彼得堡一家媒体 Fontanka 称，警方在其中一间公寓查获了“600 多件被盗的圣像”隐藏在壁橱后面的秘密房间里”。丰坦卡说，一些没收的圣像被转移到俄罗斯冬宫博物馆和圣彼得堡神学院。

;

;莱文从阿姆斯特丹监狱获释后，又在俄罗斯监狱里度过了两年。

;

;尽管遭到逮捕，莱文多年来似乎积累了大量财富。

;

;根据与《卫报》分享的文件，莱文在圣彼得堡拥有 10 多处房产，其中包括俄罗斯第二大城市高档社区的几处房产。最大的城市。

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 15:22:01 +0800 Making Squid Game reality TV show posed problem of how to ‘shoot’ playershttps://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2023/nov/07/making-squid-game-reality-tv-show-posed-problem-of-how-to-shoot-players
;;2023-11-07T06:00:01Z;
;
;;穿着红色工装、遮住脸的人物
;

;拍摄新的《鱿鱼游戏》真人秀电视节目制作人表示，该游戏引发了“很多问题”，包括对如何“射击”参赛者的担忧。

;

;Squid Game：挑战赛将有来自世界各地的 456 名参赛者争夺巨额现金奖励，就像韩国热门虚构剧一样。

;

;该剧是 Netflix 在原版《乌贼游戏》取得巨大成功后委托制作的，在《乌贼游戏》中，穷人被引诱去玩致命版本的儿童游戏，冒着死亡的风险换取财富.

;

;这部虚构剧集在 2021 年上映后的前 28 天里，有 1.42 亿家庭观看，累计观看时长达到 16.5 亿小时。

;

;“这是一个非常不寻常的项目，”史蒂芬·兰伯特 (Stephen Lambert) – 其 Studio Lambert 被流媒体聘请来制作真人秀 – 告诉《广播时报》。

;

;“但是拥有一部非常成功的电视剧，其中包括一个可以真实玩的游戏，这提供了一个几乎独特的机会用于交叉。尽管玩真实的游戏会遇到很多问题。”

;

;这个虚构的节目包括《红灯》、《绿灯》等游戏，还有更残酷的音乐椅游戏，其中参赛者被机关枪枪杀。如果当一个巨大的娃娃旋转头部并停止唱歌时，他们被发现在移动。

;

;“一开始大家普遍认为杀死参赛者不是一个好主意，”兰伯特开玩笑说。此前的真人秀节目包括《Gogglebox》、《The Circle》和 BBC One 获得英国电影和电视艺术学院奖的《叛徒》。

;

;他还表示，在美国频发的背景下，制片人认真考虑了如何描绘失败者的“枪杀”场面。校园枪击事件以及包括乌克兰和中东在内的全球战争。

;

;“我们决定，玩家所佩戴的爆管在被淘汰时会爆炸，液体不应该是红色的，而是黑色的...这从来都不是血腥的。”

;

;除了淘汰之外，衍生作品在其他方面与原作非常相似。兰伯特说：“我们一开始就认为他们不可能指望我们选到 456 名演员，但他们非常清楚他们确实这么做了。”

;

;他补充说，Netflix 也“明确表示他们想要一个大量北美人，因为按照他们的说法，该剧确实必须在那里发挥作用，但该剧是一种全球现象，因此在选角方面必须是一个全球性的机会。”

;

;兰伯特说他令人惊喜的是，主播“坚决坚持奖金为 456 万美元”，相当于每位玩家 10,000 美元，这使得《鱿鱼游戏：挑战》成为电视历史上最大的游戏节目，单项奖金也最高。

;

; “事实上，奖项如此之大，是如何改编一部完全是关于在你无法拍摄时被拍摄的戏剧的解决方案，”他说。

;

;“这个奖项会改变生活。 。所以，当你被淘汰的时候，你当初的梦想也就随之消亡了。对这种情况发生的恐惧决定了参赛者玩游戏和互动的方式。”

;

;今年早些时候，;Netflix 在拍摄过程中表示“声称严重受伤”;节目不属实，一位未透露姓名的参赛者声称，在一场比赛中，由于演播室温度较低，多人需要就医。

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 14:22:02 +0800 85% of people worry about online disinformation, global survey findshttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/nov/07/85-of-people-worry-about-online-disinformation-global-survey-finds
;;2023-11-07T06:00:00Z;
;
;;手机上的社交媒体应用
;

;超过 85% 的人担心一项全球调查显示，随着联合国宣布一项解决这一现象的计划，87% 的人认为这已经损害了他们国家的政治。

;

;联合国文化机构总干事奥黛丽·阿祖莱 (Audrey Azoulay)，联合国教科文组织周一告诉记者，网上的虚假信息和仇恨言论——被社交媒体平台加速和放大——对“社会凝聚力、和平与稳定构成了重大风险”。

;

;迫切需要监管“以保护访问权”阿祖莱在为政府、监管机构和平台提供“治理蓝图”时说道。

;

;联合国教科文组织委托对 16 个国家进行的调查该组织表示，明年举行全国选举（共有 25 亿选民），这表明有效监管的必要性已变得多么迫切。

;

;;民意调查机构 Ipsos; 对奥地利、克罗地亚、美国、阿尔及利亚、墨西哥、加纳和印度等国家的 8,000 人进行了调查，发现 56% 的互联网用户主要从社交媒体获取新闻，远远多于电视 (44%) 或媒体网站 (29%)。

;

;社交媒体是几乎所有国家的新闻主要来源。每个国家/地区，尽管对其提供的信息的信任度明显低于传统媒体：电视为 50%，广播为 66%，广播为 63%，媒体网站和应用程序为 57%。

;

;在所有 16 个国家/地区68% 的受访者表示，社交媒体是假新闻最普遍的地方，领先于即时通讯应用程序 (38%)，这一信念“在所有国家、年龄段、社会背景和政治偏好中都普遍存在”。

;

; 绝大多数人将虚假信息视为具体威胁，85% 的人表示他们担心其影响。 87% 的受访者表示，虚假信息已经对国家政治生活产生了重大影响，并将在 2024 年的选举中发挥作用。

;

;仇恨言论也被认为很普遍：67% 的受访者表示他们见过这种言论在线（以及 74% 的 35 岁以下人群）。大多数人 (88%) 表示政府和监管机构必须解决这两个问题，90% 的人还希望平台采取行动。

;

;在竞选期间保持警惕尤为重要。在接受调查的人中，89% 的人要求政府和监管机构进行干预，91% 的人预计当民主直接发挥作用时社交媒体平台会更加警惕。

;

;“每个国家和社会的人们都非常担心虚假信息。类别——年龄、教育程度、农村或城市，”益普索的马蒂厄·加拉德 (Mathieu Gallard) 说道。 “他们在选举期间尤其担心 - 他们希望所有参与者都与之抗争。”

;

;联合国教科文组织表示;基于七项关键原则的计划;是在联合国系统内“史无前例”的磋商过程中产生的，在 18 个月的时间里借鉴了来自 134 个国家的 10,000 多份贡献。

;

;联合国教科文组织言论自由部门负责人 Guilherme Canela de Souza Godoi 表示，50 多个国家已经在监管社交媒体，但往往不符合国际言论自由和人权规范。

;

;他说，这些指导方针代表了“基于人权方法的强有力的蓝图，旨在为政府和监管机构提供信息和激励”，并补充说，一些非洲和拉丁美洲国家已经表达了兴趣。

;

;至少联合国教科文组织表示，一个主要平台告诉这个由 194 个成员国组成的联合国机构，它更喜欢一致的全球治理框架，而不是扩散的国家和区域体系。它计划于 2024 年组织一次世界监管者会议。

;

;它表示，必须尊重七项关键原则，以确保对人权的影响成为“每个阶段、每个阶段所有决策的指南针”。联合国教科文组织表示，各地必须建立独立且资源充足的公共监管机构，并作为更广泛网络的一部分密切合作，以防止数字组织利用国家监管差异。< /p>;

;平台必须在所有地区和所有语言中有效、大规模地调节内容，并且“对那些往往以牺牲可靠信息为代价来最大化参与度的算法负责和透明”。<联合国教科文组织表示，在选举和武装冲突和灾难等危机期间，监管机构和平台还必须采取更强有力的措施，包括风险评估、内容标记和提高政治广告的透明度。

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 14:22:02 +0800 ‘Grenade among birthday gifts’ kills adviser to Ukraine’s military chiefhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/07/grenade-among-birthday-gifts-kills-adviser-to-ukraines-military-chief
;;2023-11-07T04:34:42Z;
;
;;根纳季·查斯蒂亚科夫，
;

;乌克兰军队总司令的亲密顾问been killed after a grenade amongst his birthday presents exploded, according to officials.

;

;“Under tragic circumstances, my assistant and close friend, Major Gennadiy Chastiakov, was killed … on his birthday,” Gen Valery Zaluzhny posted on Telegram on Monday, saying that an “unknown explosive device detonated in one of his gifts”.

;

;Chastiakov's death was initially reported as a suspected assassination using a booby-trapped gift until further details emerged. Ukraine's interior minister, Igor Klymenko, released a statement saying Chastiakov had been showing his son a box with grenades inside that he had received as a gift.

;

;“At first, the son took the munition in his hands and began to turn the ring. Then the serviceman took the grenade away from the child and pulled the ring, causing a tragic explosion,” Klymenko said.

;

;Police had identified a fellow soldier who gave the gift, said Klymenko, and seized two similar grenades. An investigation was under way.

;

;Ukrainian police said the 13-year-old son was also seriously injured. Ukrainska Pravda reported Chastiakov's wife as saying the grenade was in a gift bag her husband brought home. Some reports suggested the real grenade was amongst novelty gifts shaped to look like grenades.

;

;Chastiakov had left a wife and four children, Klymenko said. Zaluzhny added that since Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022, Chastiakov had been “fully devoting his life to the armed forces of Ukraine and the fight against Russian aggression”.

;

;Also on Monday, Ukrainian forces said they had successfully destroyed a Russian ship in the Kerch shipyard in annexed Crimea, and Ukraine's president, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, said he did not believe the time was right for the country to hold elections, amid a brewing debate on the possibility of a presidential vote in 2024.

;

;All elections including the presidential vote due to take place next spring are technically cancelled under the martial law that has been in effect since the war began last year.

;

;“We must decide that now is the time of defence, the time of battle, on which the fate of the state and people depends,” Zelenskiy said in his daily address.他表示，现在是国家团结的时候，而不是分裂的时候，并补充道：“我认为现在不是选举的时候。”

;

;乌克兰外交部长上周表示，泽连斯基正在权衡利弊。鉴于入侵，明年是否有可能举行选举。他警告说，由于 ;A hose for an emissions test fixed to a car exhaust;

;The EU is poised to water down a landmark piece of car pollution legislation after extensive lobbying from the automotive industry, which experts say will cause an estimated €100bn in health and environmental costs.

;

;;Analysis; provided by the ;Consortium for Ultra-low Vehicle Emissions; (Clove) exclusively to the Guardian and Voxeurop shows that half of the projected financial savings from the new Euro 7 standards on car emissions will be lost due to damage caused by excess nitrogen dioxide. This toxic gas is the main contaminant released by combustion engines, especially diesel ones, and was responsible for ;49,000 premature deaths; in the EU and 5,750 in the UK in just one year.

;

;Clove, whose members include Europe's top academic, research and business specialists in the automotive sector, acted as paid consultants for the European Commission – in effect the EU's civil service – to examine the most effective policy options for Euro 7, the latest in a series of bills regulating pollution from car emissions.

;

;Clove experts recommended significantly reducing the amount of nitrogen dioxide that vehicles are allowed to emit, and tightening real driving conditions in the approval tests for new models.

;

;However, under an ;agreement; made by the EU's 27 member states in September, limits for nitrogen dioxide (and other harmful pollutants such as ultrafine particles), as well as approval tests, would be practically unchanged from those in the previous legislation, Euro 6. The only significant reform is that limits on particulate emission from tyres and brakes would be regulated for the first time.

;

;Carmakers had said the commission's proposal was “entirely disproportionate, driving high costs for industry and customers with limited environmental benefits”. The European parliament is due to vote on the Euro 7 proposal on Thursday.

;

;Clove says the costs for the industry to produce cleaner vehicles – estimated at about €30bn – would be far less than the expected €182bn benefit to the EU that stronger restrictions on road pollution could have brought.

;

;“Our cost-benefit analysis is based on transparent modelling assumptions and a thorough dialogue with all stakeholders, including carmakers and automotive suppliers,” said Prof Zissis Samaras, a coordinator of Clove.

;

;Carmakers lobbied extensively for the proposed reforms to be watered down. Emails and minutes obtained by the Guardian and Voxeurop through freedom of information requests show that the commission was lobbied heavily by the European Automobile Manufacturers' Association (Acea).

;

;In a secret ;meeting; on 1 June 2022 between a representative of the European commissioner for the single market, Thierry Breton, and the then chair of Acea, Oliver Zipse, who is also the CEO of BMW, carmakers argued against strict nitrogen dioxide emissions limits and in favour of keeping weak approval tests.

;

;;Minutes; show that the representative assured the lobbyist that the commission would “set ambitious but feasible requirements”. The proposal presented by the commission in November 2022 largely adopted the ;emission limits recommended by the industry;, against the advice given by Clove consultants and despite the EU having spent €80m on projects, often with carmakers, showing that affordable upgrades to reduce emissions were possible with current technologies.

;

;The meeting between the commission representative and Acea was not declared on the public transparency register, despite it being ;mandatory to disclose such meetings;.

;

;“The meeting was not recorded on time due to an administrative oversight. It has been recorded now,” a commission spokesperson said.

;

;Several sources indicated that lower exhaust emissions limits were traded off by the commission as part of an unspoken deal to secure industry support for the EU-wide phase-out of combustion engines in 2035.

;

;Matthias Johansson, the head of public affairs at Volvo, told the Guardian that a stringent Euro 7 would require “committing resources and engineers back to combustion engine technology which will become obsolete in just a few years from now”.

;

;Legislative proposals by the commission have to be approved by national governments, and a weak initial proposal leaves less room for negotiations.

;

;Environmental NGOs criticised the weakened legislation. Anna Krajinska, the manager of vehicle emissions and air quality at Transport & Environment, said: “Ninety-five million new vehicles certified as Euro 7 will be sold until 2035. Without effective rules reducing emissions, many of these vehicles will keep poisoning our air until at least 2050, above the safeguards recommended by the WHO.” She said the Euro 7 proposal was a “greenwashed Euro 6”.

;

;In practice, legal emission limits are still often exceeded, ;recent testing has found;. Experts say current laboratory measurements fail to capture real driving conditions, for example in older cars, in cold temperatures, or for trips shorter than 16km (10 miles), which typically take place in urban areas.

;

;Industry opposition to upgrading emissions tests echoes the 2015 Dieselgate scandal, where manufacturers used software trickery to circumvent the rules capping tailpipe fumes.

;

;The International Council on Clean Transportation said a timely enforcement of the commission proposal would prevent 7,300 premature deaths in the EU by 2050.

;

;Krajinska said: “For each billion earned by a few carmakers, European citizens will lose several billions in diseases, hospitalisations, degradation of natural assets and other social costs. Member states should be ashamed for putting profiteers' interests over the health of their own citizens.”

;

;The commission and Acea confirmed that the June 2022 meeting had taken place. “Acea did indeed refer to proposals for Euro 7, which had been sent to Commissioner Breton,” an Acea spokesperson said.

;

;A commission spokesperson said: “The Euro 7 proposal is not the result of the requests from one stakeholder, but rather the fruit of a careful examination … following a very wide consultation with all stakeholders.”

;

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 13:52:02 +0800 Allegations of extensive sexual abuse at Kenyan offsetting project used by Shell and Netflixhttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/nov/07/accusations-of-widespread-sexual-abuse-at-offsetting-project-used-by-netflix-and-shell-aoe
;;2023-11-07T05:00:03Z;
;
;;A panoramic view of African savanna
;

;Male staff at a leading Kenyan carbon-offsetting project used by Netflix, Shell and other large companies have been accused of extensive sexual abuse and harassment over more than a decade, following an investigation by two NGOs.

;

;The Kasigau Corridor conservation project in southern Kenya, operated by the California-based firm Wildlife Works, generates carbon credits by protecting dryland forests at risk of being destroyed in key elephant, lion and wildlife habitats west of Mombasa. The scheme was the first ever forest protection scheme approved by Verra, the world's leading certifier of carbon offsets, and has also been accredited for its biodiversity and community benefits, probably generating millions of dollars in revenue in carbon-credit sales.

;

;A new report by the Kenya Human Rights Commission (KHRC) and the Centre for Research on Multinational Corporations (Somo), a Dutch NGO, alleges extensive sexual abuse, harassment and exploitation between 2011 and 2023 by senior male employees of Wildlife Works, according to the testimonies of 31 current and former male and female staff as well as members of the local community.

;

;In a statement on Friday, which was updated on Sunday, ;Wildlife Works' president, Mike Korchinsky, said; after the company was made aware of the allegations in August, it suspended three people. An internal investigation conducted by a Kenyan law firm found evidence that two individuals had engaged in “deeply inappropriate and harmful behaviour”, he said.

;

;Korchinsky apologised for the “pain that had been caused” but denied the problem was widespread, saying that the substantiated sexual harassment misconduct had been perpetrated by one individual. He also said some of the allegations had not been substantiated.

;

;Wildlife Works said it was in the final stages of the disciplinary process and would say more once it had finished. On Friday, ;Verra said it had launched an investigation; into the project.

;

;The report, based on interviews by staff from the NGOs, who are trained in dealing with gender-based violence, includes allegations of a physical assault and attempted rape on company premises.

;

;Senior men used their positions to demand sex in return for promotions and better treatment, the report alleges. The wives of male rangers were also pursued by one perpetrator, a senior member of staff, who allegedly told them that their husbands' jobs depended on them having sex with him.

;

;In a letter sent in August to Wildlife Works from Somo and the KHRC, seen by the Guardian, the organisations alleged extensive sexual abuse at the project by multiple members of staff. They only named one alleged perpetrator but stated that the issue was extensive.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Carbon credit speculators could lose billions as offsets deemed 'worthless';

;
;

;Kasigau Corridor conservation project is marketed for its contribution to women's empowerment in the area, a claim echoed by some ;firms that have bought credits, such as Netflix;. One video, produced by Netflix to promote the project, says “a key part of this project is empowering women”. Shell has bought nearly 2m credits from the scheme, according to data from AlliedOffsets, while Netflix has bought a quarter of a million. Several other large companies have used credits from the project for climate and biodiversity commitments. Netflix did not respond to a request for comment.

;

;Somo's executive director, Audrey Gaughran, said that during interviews with affected women, it became clear that the allegations were well known among employees. “We received accounts from women, who were current and past employees of Wildlife Works, who were sexually harassed, sexually assaulted, physically assaulted in sexual ways,” she said. “Sexualised slurs were shouted at women.”

; ;

;“Perpetrators could act with relative impunity because they were senior males and nobody seemed to be able to touch them. One perpetrator in particular, the most named, goes to the wives of rangers once the rangers are stationed out on the property. The implication is: 'Your husband has a job because of me. Do you want him to keep his job?' That was very difficult for some of the men to talk about,” she said.

;

;The allegations come amid widespread concerns about the environmental integrity of many forest protection offsets. This year, a joint ;Guardian investigation; found huge numbers of credits were “largely worthless” and found ;evidence of forced clearances at a leading project; in Peru. The findings were disputed by Verra.

;

;Verra is expected to release its new rules for generating carbon credits ahead of the Cop28 climate change conference in Dubai, which begins later this month.
